item.title: 滑雪运动的新气候预测：六月降水量达 30 英尺
item.description:
尽管冬季更加难以预测，但 "雪地耕作 "让度假胜地延长了滑雪季节。【原文：

"Snow farming" is letting resorts stretch the season despite more unpredictable winters.

】

item.title: 不用美元应对气候变化
item.description: 继美国退出南非和印度尼西亚的主要绿色转型协议之后，今天的通讯将关注全球气候融资倡议的现状。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享这些报道。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the state of climate finance initiatives around the world following news the US has pulled out of major green transition deals in South Africa and Indonesia. You can also read and share these stories on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 加州电动汽车充电成本高昂，其他地方却很划算
item.description:
BNEF 分析了美国哪些地方的电动汽车插电成本最高，哪些地方最低。【原文：

BNEF analyzes where it’s most and least expensive to plug in your electric vehicle in the US.

】

item.title: 新的人工智能天气模型已在改变能源交易方式
item.description:
欧洲预测中心的系统将帮助电力和天然气交易商在受气候变化影响的市场中更快地采取行动。【原文：

The European forecasting center’s system is poised to help power and gas traders make quicker moves in markets convulsed by climate change.

】

item.title: 为南非提供 26 亿美元绿色基金的决定即将做出
item.description: 据知情人士透露，与世界银行有联系的气候投资基金最早可能于本周五决定向南非拨付资金，以启动一项价值 26 亿美元的绿色融资计划。【原文：A decision on a disbursement by the World Bank-linked Climate Investment Funds that would trigger a $2.6 billion green-finance package for South Africa may be made as early as Friday, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 净零增长与英国经济增长之间是否存在权衡？
item.description:
Peel Hunt的Kallum Pickering加入Merryn Talks Money 讨论地缘政治动荡如何使安全能源变得更加必要。【原文：

Peel Hunt’s Kallum Pickering joins Merryn Talks Money to discuss how geopolitical tumult has made secure energy more of an imperative. 

】

item.title: 阿尔弗雷德气旋缓慢而不稳定的路径给预报员带来挑战
item.description: 过去一周，威胁澳大利亚东南海岸的气旋路径蜿蜒曲折，这给预报员带来了挑战，因为他们要为风暴路径上的居民提供确定的路径。【原文：A cyclone threatening Australia’s southeast coast has taken a long and meandering path over the past week, challenging forecasters seeking to provide residents in the storm’s path with certainty on its track.】

item.title: 美国退出印尼气候协议，日本和德国加紧行动
item.description: 日本财务大臣确认，在美国退出一项旨在帮助亚洲最大污染国之一摆脱化石燃料的 200 亿美元计划之后，日本将继续支持印尼的能源转型。【原文：Japan’s finance minister confirmed the nation will continue to support Indonesia’s energy transition following the exit of the US from a $20 billion initiative to help one of Asia’s biggest polluters shift away from fossil fuels.】

item.title: 罕见气旋尚未登陆便在澳大利亚造成严重破坏
item.description: 一场逼近澳大利亚第三大城市布里斯班的气旋--该地区 50 多年来的第一场气旋--在登陆之前就已经造成了混乱，狂风刮倒了电线，切断了数千家庭的电力供应。【原文：A cyclone approaching Australia’s third-largest city Brisbane — the region’s first in more than 50 years — is already causing mayhem before it makes landfall, with gale force winds downing power lines and cutting electricity supply to thousands of homes.】

item.title: 车辆限行后伦敦空气质量有所改善
item.description: 伦敦市长办公室发布的一份报告显示，伦敦扩大低排放区的决定降低了空气污染，同时也没有影响商业人流或消费。【原文：London’s decision to expand a low-emission zone has led to lower air pollution without impacting business footfall or spending, according to a report released by the mayor’s office.】

item.title: 伯根说，美国海上风电审查将考虑风电场状况
item.description: 内政部长道格-伯格姆（Doug Burgum）周四表示，特朗普政府正在进行的海上风电项目审查将对现有项目和那些仍处于拟议阶段的项目区别对待。【原文：The Trump administration’s ongoing review of offshore wind projects will feature different treatment for existing ventures versus those that are still merely in the proposed stage, Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said Thursday.】

item.title: 气候审查后，道富失去丹麦基金授权
item.description: 国泰君安全球顾问公司（State Street Global Advisors）失去了与一家丹麦养老基金的合作授权，这是对这家总部位于波士顿的资产管理公司气候承诺评估审查的一部分。【原文：State Street Global Advisors lost a mandate it had with a Danish pension fund, as part of a review that included an assessment of the Boston-based asset manager’s climate commitments.】

item.title: 英国表示，世界必须准备好在没有美国的情况下应对气候变化
item.description: 英国气候特使表示，随着特朗普政府撤回数十亿美元用于资助绿色转型倡议的承诺，世界需要做好准备，在没有美国的帮助下应对全球变暖。【原文：The world needs to prepare to fight global warming without the help of the US as the Trump administration pulls billions of dollars pledged to initiatives funding the green transition, the UK’s climate envoy said.】

item.title: COP30 东道主巴西表示：特朗普关税威胁气候进步
item.description: 巴西环境部长玛丽娜-席尔瓦（Marina Silva）表示，美国新关税引发的全球贸易战可能会消耗各国资源，削弱各国对绿色目标的信任，从而减缓气候方面的进展。【原文：New US tariffs fueling a global trade war may slow climate progress by draining countries’ resources and eroding trust among countries over green goals, said Brazil’s Environment Minister Marina Silva.】

item.title: 科斯拉支持从空气中提取碳的初创公司
item.description:
这位亿万富翁的风险投资公司提供的资金将帮助 Spiritus 公司在新墨西哥州建立一家试验工厂。【原文：

Funding from the billionaire’s venture capital shop will help Spiritus develop a pilot plant in New Mexico.

】

item.title: 银行为何不断降低气候目标
item.description:
虽然右翼政治显然与此有关，但也有观点认为科学现实也与此有关。【原文：

While it’s clear right-wing politics has something to do with it, there’s an argument that scientific reality does, too.

】

item.title: 印度绿色投资可能因项目滞销而受阻
item.description: 印度能源经济与金融分析研究所（Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis）称，印度越来越多计划中的可再生能源项目无法获得潜在的电力买家，这威胁到该国的绿色能源目标。【原文：A growing number of planned renewable projects in India are failing to secure prospective power buyers, threatening the country’s green energy goals, according to the Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis.】

item.title: 星展集团警告遏制亚洲排放的努力可能更加艰难
item.description: 东南亚最大的贷款机构星展集团控股有限公司（DBS Group Holdings Ltd.）警告说，由于该银行试图支持重污染行业实现低碳化，与其客户相关的排放量在短期内可能会上升。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd., Southeast Asia’s largest lender, warned emissions tied to its customers could rise in the short-term as the bank attempts to support heavy polluting industries to decarbonize.】

item.title: 美国通知南非退出 JETP 计划
item.description: 据南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）办公室的一个部门透露，美国已经退出了世界上最富有的几个国家与南非签订的一项价值 93 亿美元的气候融资协议。【原文：The US has has withdrawn from a $9.3-billion climate finance pact between some of the world’s richest countries and South Africa, according to a unit in the office of President Cyril Ramaphosa.】

item.title: 特朗普的攻击如何加剧加拿大的气候反弹
item.description:
"无论我们的联邦选举结果如何，气候政策界都承认需要更多地关注省级行动，"加拿大气候研究所所长里克-史密斯（Rick Smith）在本周的《零点》节目中说道。【原文：

“ Regardless of what happens in our federal election, there’s the acknowledgment in the climate policy community that more attention needs to be put on provincial action,” Canadian Climate Institute President Rick Smith says on this week’s Zero.

】

item.title: 缓慢移动的气旋有可能淹没澳大利亚东海岸
item.description: 澳大利亚东南沿海的数百万居民正面临着长时间的强降雨，可能会引发山洪暴发，因为热带气旋正缓慢地向澳大利亚第三大城市移动。【原文：Millions of residents on Australia’s southeast coast are facing a prolonged period of heavy rainfall that threatens flash flooding, as a tropical cyclone slowly tracks toward the nation’s third-biggest city.】

item.title: 投资者面临 23 亿美元 "搁浅 "化石燃料资产的风险
item.description: 一项新的分析显示，向低碳经济的转型有可能导致价值 2.3 万亿美元的资产在下一个十年结束前搁浅。【原文：The transition to a low-carbon economy has the potential to leave assets worth $2.3 trillion stranded by the end of the next decade, according to a new analysis.】

item.title: 昆布鲁克称电池技术突破将有助于能源转型
item.description: 投资者昆布鲁克基础设施合作伙伴公司（Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners）表示，正在澳大利亚推广的一种新型长效电池现在可以与抽水蓄能等成熟技术相抗衡。【原文：A new long-duration battery being rolled out in Australia can now compete with established technologies such as pumped hydro, said investor Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners.】

item.title: 美国对欧盟 "敌对 "ESG规则的全球影响日益愤怒
item.description: 随着跨大西洋关系日益紧张，欧洲的环境、社会和公司治理法规正成为另一个可能导致关系恶化的热点。【原文：As trans-Atlantic relations grow increasingly fraught, Europe’s ESG regulations are becoming yet another flashpoint that threatens to sour ties.】

item.title: 洛杉矶县就致命野火起诉爱迪生公用事业公司
item.description: 洛杉矶县起诉爱迪生国际公司，要求赔偿因伊顿大火造成的损失。【原文：Los Angeles County sued Edison International to recover damages related to the deadly Eaton Fire, which ripped through the community of Altadena.】

item.title: 特朗普批准埃克森黄金通道液化天然气项目延期
item.description: 特朗普政府周三延长了美国一个大型液化天然气出口项目的许可期限，以兑现向亚洲和其他国家供应液化天然气的承诺。【原文：The Trump administration extended a permit for a major US liquefied natural gas export project Wednesday as the president seeks to follow through on a pledge to supply Asia and other nations with the fuel.】

item.title: 从得克萨斯州到缅因州的强风暴引发雨雪和狂风
item.description: 一场强劲的深冬风暴正以大雨、大雪和大风袭击美国中部和东部地区，导致数百个航班取消，40 多万户家庭和企业停电。【原文：A powerful late-winter storm is battering the central and eastern US with heavy rain, snow and wind, canceling hundreds of flights and leaving more than 400,000 homes and businesses without power.】

item.title: 关税和 Con Ed 涨价加剧了纽约市的经济负担危机
item.description:
安大略省威胁要对供应给该州的电力进行报复性征税，而该市的主要公用事业公司正在寻求批准提高电费。【原文：

Ontario is threatening retaliatory levies on electricity supplied to the state — just as the city’s main utility is seeking approval for higher bills.

】

item.title: 热泵市场？特朗普的关税对您意味着什么？
item.description:
随着国外生产的气候友好型产品和组件价格上涨，预计购买热泵、电动汽车和家用电池的费用将会增加。【原文：

Expect to pay more for heat pumps, EVs and home batteries as climate-friendly products and components made abroad get more expensive.

】

item.title: 条件达到甜蜜点，欧洲将迎来大量太阳能发电
item.description: 三月伊始的晴朗天气将推动西欧太阳能发电量达到历史最高水平。【原文：A sunny start to March will help push solar power generation in western Europe to the highest ever for this month.】
